resources.string:
What does JSON stand for?
 [A] Java Script Object Native
 [B] Java Script Oriented Notation
 [C] Java Script Object Notation
 [D] Java Script Orientation Nerd
 [E] None of the above{C}

What is the range of a short data type in Java?
 [A] -128 to 127
 [B] -32768 to 32767
 [C] -2147483648 to 2147483647
 [D] -127 to 128
 [E] None of the above{B}

Which of the following loops will execute the body of the loop even when the condition controlling the loop is initially false?
 [A] while
 [B] for
 [C] switch
 [D] for-in
 [E] do-while{E}

Which of these jump statements can skip processing the remainder of the code in its body for a particular iteration?
 [A] break
 [B] return
 [C] exit
 [D] continue
 [E] All of the above{D}

Which of these classes is a superclass of the String and StringBuffer class?
 [A] java.util
 [B] ArrayList
 [C] String
 [D] java.lang
 [E] There is no superclass
{D}

Which of these operators can be used to concatenate two or more String objects?
 [A] +
 [B] +=
 [C] &
 [D] ||
 [E] .add{A}

Which of these standard collection classes implements a dynamic array?
 [A] AbstractList
 [B] LinkedList
 [C] ArrayList
 [D] AbstractSet
 [E] SkipList{C}

Which of these methods is used to obtain the size of an ArrayList?
 [A] capacity()
 [B] length()
 [C] size()
 [D] index()
 [E] max(){C}

What are the stages of the Activity lifecycle?
 [A] onCreate(), onStart(), onResume(), onPause(), onStop(), onDestroy()
 [B] onCreate(), onStart(), onResume(), onStop(), onDestroy()
 [C] onStart(), onResume(), onPause(), onDestroy(), onStop()
 [D] onStart(), onResume(), onPause(), onStop(), onDestroy(), onClose()
 [E] None of the above{A}
